alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Wrangell (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 8:54AM AKST until December 24 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... The first frontal band is over the north gulf coast. A break between fronts over the north and central panhandle where very light snow is happening with little accumulation. To the south, the second frontal band is progressing northward across Prince of Wales. This band will reach the Juneau area in the late afternoon, while weakening. The rain snow line has already reached Ketchikan this morning. Snow totals so far have ranged from 2 inches to up to 13 inches. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected and light freezing rain possible. Storm total snow accumulation of 7 to 10 inches. * WHERE...City and Borough of Wrangell. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Possible power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation band number two will be moving into the area this morning, bringing more snow to the area. A period of light freezing rain is possible Saturday before a change over to all rain.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
